titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Oct. 25 : a machine readable transcription of an image

It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Oct. 25
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Monday October 25, 1824 session of court, during which two cases involving debt pleas were heard. It also lists the names of the judges and jurors for this session. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Monday 25
div.p: Court conveyed agreeable to adjournment, Present Their Honors John Martin, James Daniel, Richard Walker, Circuit Judges. Jurors George Saunders Foreman, Thomas Saunders, The Young Glass, Daniel Griffin, The Chip, The Hair Trimmer ,

Daniel McCoy agent for Ken & Grahan
Cpt Captain
vs
Avery Vann & William Welch
Dft Defendant
a please of debt laid over

Susannah Beck
Ptf Plaintiff
vs
John Terryl Dft
a plea of debt for an improvement It is the opinion of the Court that J. Terryl shall pay Susannah Beck $200
Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock
